intro: Ayapana tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovarensis ayapana, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its erect stem and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its berries, which are toxic to humans, are used in traditional medicine by local communities. Ayapana tovarensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests.
